skeletonlisp
Class Environment

java.lang.Object
  skeletonlisp.Environment

public class Environment
extends java.lang.Object

Environment is basically a HashMap-pair of IDs and their value bindings. it is used to create global variables, or to change the binding of an existing global variable.

Once bound in an environment, a global variable cannot be unbound in that particular environment.

Field Summary
private  java.util.HashMap<LId,LExp> associations
          associations holds all the ID - value -bindings in an environment.

private java.util.HashMap<LId,LExp> associations
associations holds all the ID - value -bindings in an environment.

Constructor Detail

Environment

public Environment()

Method Detail

extendEnvironment

public void extendEnvironment(LId key,
                              LExp binding)
method used to extend an environment with an ID - value -pair

Parameters:
key - The ID to be bound
binding - The value that the ID is to be bound to

if key is an ID that was previously unbound, a new entry is created for the key-binding -pair in associations, otherwise the existing binding of key is changed to the desired new binding.

containsId

public boolean containsId(LId key)
method used to check whether a binding exists in an environment for the desired key

Parameters:
key - the desired ID
Returns:
true if a binding for the key exists, otherwise false

getValueOf

public LExp getValueOf(LId key)
method used to get the value of a bound ID

Parameters:
key - the bound ID
Returns:
returns the binding for the key, if such exists, otherwise null

getAssociations

public java.util.HashMap<LId,LExp> getAssociations()
For testing purposes only

Returns:
returns the associations HashMap
